titleStmt.title: A reply to the defence of the bank setting forth the unreasonableness of their slow payments. To which is added, 1. The mischiefs that attend the buying and selling bank-notes. 2. The advantages England will reap by having the unclipt hammer'd mony pass currant into the Exchequer by weight. In a letter to his friend in the countrey. By a true lover of his countrey and the present government.
titleStmt.author: True lover of his countrey and the present government.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for E. Whitlock, and sold by most booksellers,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Guildhall Library, London.
